results.title: The Health connection
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Ferryman Productions and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the NSW sewage system, in particular around the Sydney area. Shows the maintenance of the existing operation as well as the planning and construction of additional services to meet the increasing demands newly-settled areas. Stresses the quality control that is implemented to ensure that pollution levels remain below those that could endanger the health of the community.

results.title: The Haunting of Barney Palmer
results.brief_description: Barney Palmer was eight years old when his haunting began, Whispers in the waves, images in the mirror, voices in his dreams. Is it the ghost of his great Uncle Barnaby or is it the ghost of somebody not yet dead? Someone, somewhere in this world or in the next is promising to carry him away. For Barney, the answer lies close within the strength of his home.

results.title: The Hare and the Tortoise
results.brief_description: An all-star cast of real animals and birds feature in this charming tale for children, based on Aesop’s fable. The wise old owl acts as judge, the fox lays out the woodland course for the race, the raccoon (who wakes up the sleeping hare, too late, of course), the gossipy goose, the rooster, and the hare and the tortoise, whose contest proves that the race is not always to the swift, all appear.

results.title: The Happy pace of Switzerland
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Gessner, Condor Films and Swiss National Tourist Office
results.brief_description: A story without words set to Rossini’s “String Sonata in C Major” performed by the Zurich Chamber Orchestra led by Edmond de Stoutz, involves a modern day fantasy about a truck driver’s encounter with an elegant, riderless, horse drawn coach. The parallel paths of truck and coach on the opposite shores of a lovely Swiss lake merge in a climax when the driver abandons his truck and joyfully takes up the reins behind the trotting white horse.

results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company and Mack Sennett Comedies
results.brief_description: The plot is a satire derived from Hugh Antoine D’Arcy’s poem “The Face on the bar room floor. It tells of the broken-down artist (Charlie Chaplin) who, having lost his wife (Cecile Arnold) to another man, draws her face on the floor of a bar room. Charlie tells his tragic story in flashbacks. NB: Silent film with no soundtrack.
